name: George III Preserved from Assassination
obverse: Bust of George III facing left.
reverse: Altar with flame on top. Smoke rises on the left and right of the flame. Above the altar is the all-seeing eye with rays coming from the triangle.
description: James Hadfield or Hatfield (1771/1772 – 23 January 1841) attempted to assassinate George III of the United Kingdom in 1800.
On the evening of 15 May 1800, at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, during the playing of the national anthem, Hadfield fired a pistol at the King standing in the royal box but missed.
